item.title: Mexico’s second run-in with Trump looks ominous for U.S.’s southern neighbor
item.description: Today, Mexico has in Claudia Sheinbaum a somewhat stern leftist ideologue as president, and Trump is not known for handling such relations well.

item.title: Taiwanese companies and people were not involved in exploding Lebanon pagers and walkie-talkies, Taiwan prosecutors say
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said Sunday he "greenlighted the pager operation".

item.title: Democrats Could Have Won. Our Excuses Mask a Devastating Reality.
item.description: Many young voters didn’t perceive the tangible impact of their 2020 support for Joe Biden, which eroded their faith in the Democratic Party.

item.title: Trump Transition Stalls Over Ethics Code, and a New Russian Offensive
The Trump Era Never Really Ended
item.description: Should we even call it a comeback?

item.title: U.K. universities brace for financial ‘crunch’ as Brexit and visa squeeze drive international students away
item.description: The decline is a major cause of concern for higher education institutions since foreign students pay far more in fees than British students.
